text: Daniel’s Integrity and His Entrapment by His Enemies

⸤It pleased Darius⸥,\f + \fr 6:1 \ft Literally “It was pleasant before Darius” \f* and he set up one hundred and twenty satraps over the kingdom, that they were ⸤throughout the whole kingdom⸥,\f + \fr 6:1 \ft Literally “in all the kingdom” \f*
and over them \add were\add* three administrators, \add of\add* whom Daniel \add was\add* one, \add so\add* that these satraps were giving account to them, and the king would not be suffering loss.

Then Daniel ⸤began distinguishing himself⸥\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “was distinguishing himself” \f* above the administrators and the satraps ⸤because⸥\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “all of because that” \f* an exceptional spirit \add was\add* in him, and \add so\add* the king planned to appoint him over the whole kingdom.

Then the \add other\add* administrators and satraps ⸤began to seek⸥\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “were seeking” \f* to find \add a\add* pretext against Daniel ⸤in connection with the kingdom⸥,\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “from the side of the kingdom” \f* but they were not able to find any pretext and ⸤corruption⸥\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “being corrupt” \f* ⸤because⸥\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “all because that” \f* he was trustworthy, and no\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Aramaic “any” \f* negligence or ⸤corruption⸥\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “being corrupt” \f* ⸤could be found in him⸥.\f + \fr 6:4 \ft Literally “not could be found” \f*

Then these men ⸤said⸥,\f + \fr 6:5 \ft Literally “\fq were \ft saying” \f* “We will not find any pretext\f + \fr 6:5 \ft Or “basis for accusation” \f* against this Daniel unless we find it in connection with the law of his God.”

So the administrators and the satraps conspired ⸤with respect to⸥\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Literally “on/upon” \f* the king and so they said to him, “Darius, O king, live ⸤forever⸥!\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Literally “to eternity” \f*

All of \add the\add* administrators of the kingdom, and the prefects, the satraps, the counselors and the governors took counsel \add and have\add* agreed to establish an edict of the king and to enforce a decree that ⸤whoever⸥\f + \fr 6:7 \ft Literally “all that” \f* will seek a prayer from any god or human except from you \add for\add* up to thirty days will be thrown into ⸤the lion pit⸥.\f + \fr 6:7 \ft Literally “pit of lions” \f*

Now, O king, establish the edict and you must sign the document \add so\add* that \add it\add* cannot be changed, according to \add the\add* law of \add the\add* Medes and Persians which cannot be revoked.”
⸤So⸥\f + \fr 6:9 \ft Literally “Like to before this” \f* the king, Darius, signed the writing and the interdict.\f + \fr 6:9 \ft Or “the writing that is the interdict” \f*

Now ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “as that” \f* Daniel realized that the document was signed, he went to his house (⸤now he had windows in his upper room that were open⸥\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “and windows were open to him in his upper room” \f* toward Jerusalem), and three times ⸤daily⸥\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “in the day” \f* he knelt on his knees and prayed and \add gave\add* praise before his God, ⸤just as⸥\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “all because that” \f* he had been doing ⸤previously⸥.\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “from before this” \f*
Then these men came as a group and they found Daniel praying and pleading for mercy before his God.

Then they approached ⸤and spoke with the king⸥\f + \fr 6:12 \ft Literally “and saying before the king” \f* concerning the edict of the king, “⸤Did you not sign an edict⸥\f + \fr 6:12 \ft Literally “Not an edict you signed?” \f* that any person who would seek \add anything\add* from any God or human within thirty days except from you, O king, would be thrown into ⸤the lion pit⸥?”\f + \fr 6:12 \ft Literally “pit of lions” \f* The king answered and said, “The matter \add as you have just stated\add* is certain according to \add the\add* law of \add the\add* Medes and Persians which cannot be revoked.”
God’s Miraculous Deliverance of Daniel Again

Then ⸤they responded⸥\f + \fr 6:13 \ft Literally “they answered” \f* and said before the king, “Daniel, who \add is\add* from ⸤the exiles⸥\f + \fr 6:13 \ft Literally “the sons of the exile” \f* of Judah,\f + \fr 6:13 \ft Aramaic “Jehud” \f* ⸤is not paying any attention⸥\f + \fr 6:13 \ft Literally “not he sets \fq his mind \ft ” \f* to you, O king, or to the decree that you have signed, ⸤and three times daily⸥\f + \fr 6:13 \ft Literally “and three times on the day” \f* he says his prayer.”

Then the king, when\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Aramaic “as ” \f* he heard that ⸤report⸥,\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Literally “word” \f* he was extremely distressed over it; and ⸤concerning Daniel⸥\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Literally “upon Daniel” \f* ⸤he was determined⸥\f + \fr 6:14 \ft Literally “he set \fq his \ft heart” \f* to rescue him. And until the setting of the sun he was making every effort to deliver him.

Then these men came as \add a\add* group to the king and ⸤said⸥,\f + \fr 6:15 \ft Literally “saying” \f* “Recall, O king, that \add with respect to\add* \add the\add* law of\f + \fr 6:15 \ft Aramaic “to” \f* \add the\add* Medes and Persians that ⸤any⸥\f + \fr 6:15 \ft Literally “all/every” \f* decree or edict that the king establishes cannot be changed.”

Then the king gave the command, and Daniel was brought in and they threw \add him\add* into ⸤the lion pit⸥.\f + \fr 6:16 \ft Literally “pit of lions” \f* ⸤The king said⸥\f + \fr 6:16 \ft Literally “The king answered and saying” \f* to Daniel, “Your God, whom you serve ⸤faithfully⸥,\f + \fr 6:16 \ft Literally “in the loyalty” \f* may he rescue you!”

And a\f + \fr 6:17 \ft Aramaic “one” \f* stone was brought and it was put on the entrance of the pit, and the king sealed it with his signet \add ring\add* and with the signet \add rings\add* of his lords,\f + \fr 6:17 \ft Or “nobles” \f* so that nothing would be changed concerning Daniel.
Then the king went to his palace and spent the night in fasting, and no food was brought in before him and his sleep fled from him.
Then the king got up at daybreak, at first light, and he went ⸤in haste⸥\f + \fr 6:19 \ft Literally “to hasten” \f* to ⸤the lion pit⸥.\f + \fr 6:19 \ft Literally “pit of lions” \f*

And ⸤when he came near⸥\f + \fr 6:20 \ft Literally “as coming near him” \f* to the pit, he cried out to Daniel with \add a\add* distressed voice, \add and\add* the king ⸤spoke⸥\f + \fr 6:20 \ft Literally “answered” \f* and said to Daniel, “O Daniel, servant of the living God, your God whom you serve faithfully, was he able to rescue you from the lions?”
Then Daniel spoke to\f + \fr 6:21 \ft Aramaic “with” \f* the king, “O king, live ⸤forever⸥!\f + \fr 6:21 \ft Literally “unto endless ages” \f*

My God sent his angel and he shut the mouth of the lions and they did not\f + \fr 6:22 \ft Aramaic “would not” \f* hurt me, ⸤because⸥\f + \fr 6:22 \ft Literally “all of because that” \f* before him ⸤I was found⸥\f + \fr 6:22 \ft Literally “it was found for me” \f* blameless, and also before you, O king, I have not done \add any\add* wrong.”

Then the king was exceedingly glad over it\f + \fr 6:23 \ft That is, the situation \f* and commanded \add that\add* Daniel be lifted up from the pit; and \add there\add* was not any wound found on him, because he had trusted in his God.

The king then commanded, and these men were brought ⸤who had accused Daniel⸥,\f + \fr 6:24 \ft Literally “they ate his pieces of Daniel” \f* and they threw them and their children and their wives into ⸤the lion pit⸥,\f + \fr 6:24 \ft Literally “pit of lions” \f* and they had not reached the floor of the pit ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 6:24 \ft Literally “until that” \f* the lions had overpowered them and they had crushed all of their bones.
The King Praises the God of Daniel and Daniel Prospers
Then Darius the king wrote to all the people, the nations, and the languages living in the whole earth, “May your prosperity become great!

⸤I make a decree⸥\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Literally “From before me is put forth a decree” \f* that in all the dominion of my kingdom \add people\add* will be trembling and fearing before the God of Daniel, for he \add is\add* the living God and endures ⸤forever⸥\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Literally “to eternity/endless ages” \f* and his\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Literally “and whose” \f* kingdom \add is\add* one that will not be destroyed and his ⸤dominion has no end⸥.\f + \fr 6:26 \ft Literally “dominion his to the end” \f*

\add He is\add* rescuing, delivering, and working signs and wonders in the heavens and on earth, for he \add has\add* rescued Daniel from the ⸤power⸥\f + \fr 6:27 \ft Literally “hand” \f* of the lions.”
So this Daniel prospered during the kingdom of Darius and during the kingdom of Cyrus the Persian.
